หุ้น CleanSpark ตกหนักก่อนรายงานผลกำไร

CleanSpark shares take a dive ahead of earnings report

1d ago//Caroline Álvarez
regulation
AI

Summary

TH

หุ้นของ CleanSpark Inc. ดิ่งลนมากกว่า 19% สู่ระดับ $8.26 เมื่อนักลงทุนเริ่มวิตกกังวลก่อนการเปิดเผยรายงานผลประกอบการไตรมาสแรกของปีงบประมาณ 2026 แรงขายดังกล่าวสะท้อนถึงความกังวลเชิงกว้างเกี่ยวกับตลาดคริปโต ซึ่งความผันผวนส่งผลกระทบต่อหุ้นเหมืองขุด Bitcoin อย่างหนัก ทั้งนี้ นักวิเคราะห์คาดการณ์กำไรต่อหุ้น (EPS) อยู่ที่ $0.09 แต่ความรู้สึกของตลาดในช่วงนี้ยังคงระมัดระวังอย่างมาก แม้จะเผชิญกับความตกต่ำในระยะสั้นและสัญญาณทางเทคนิคที่ไม่สู้ดี นักวิเคราะห์ยังคงมีมุมมองเชิงบวกต่อศักยภาพในระยะยาวของบริษัท หุ้นยังคงได้รับการจัดอันดับ 'Buy' พร้อมราคาเป้าหมายเฉลี่ยที่ $23.16 แม้ว่าบางแหล่งข้อมูลจะปรับลดราคาเป้าหมายลงเล็กน้อยก็ตาม การวิเคราะห์ทางเทคนิคชี้ว่าราคาหุ้นอยู่ต่ำกว่าค่าเฉลี่ยเคลื่อนที่ทั้ง 20 วันและ 100 วัน ส่งสัญญาณแรงกดดันด้านลบและประสิทธิภาพของตลาดที่อ่อนแอ

EN

CleanSpark Inc. shares plunged more than 19% to $8.26 as investors grew nervous ahead of the company's fiscal Q1 2026 earnings report. The decline reflects broader concerns regarding the cryptocurrency market, with volatility impacting mining stocks across the sector. Analysts are projecting an earnings per share (EPS) of $0.09, but the immediate market sentiment remains cautious amidst the turbulence. Despite the short-term stock slump and grim technical indicators, analysts remain largely bullish on the company's long-term prospects. The stock maintains a Buy rating with an average price target of $23.16, though some firms like Keefe, Bruyette & Woods have adjusted their targets lower. Technical analysis shows the stock trading significantly below its moving averages, indicating bearish momentum and weak market performance.

Key Points

  • CleanSpark shares dropped over 19% ahead of the Q1 fiscal 2026 earnings report release.
  • Technical indicators show bearish pressure, with the stock trading below 20-day and 100-day moving averages.
  • Analysts maintain a Buy rating with an average price target of $23.16, despite Bitcoin market volatility.
  • Expected earnings per share (EPS) is $0.09, amidst broader crypto market instability.

Article

CleanSpark Inc. had a rough Thursday, with shares sinking as investors brace for the company’s first-quarter fiscal 2026 earnings report, set to drop after the market closes today. It’s not exactly a “buy the rumor, sell the news” situation — more like “wait and see… but we’re nervous.” Summary CleanSpark shares drop more than 19% ahead of its fiscal Q1 2026 earnings report, with investors bracing for potential disappointment amid crypto market turmoil. Bitcoin volatility impacts sentiment, with CleanSpark trading 25.9% below its 20-day moving average and showing weak momentum, as technical indicators suggest continued bearish pressure. Analysts remain mostly bullish, maintaining a Buy Rating with a price target range between $18–$30, despite the company’s short-term struggles and crypto market instability. Analysts are pegging CleanSpark’s expected earnings per share (EPS) at $0.09 for the quarter. While that’s nice, the company’s performance comes at a time when cryptocurrency markets are as volatile as a Tesla driver’s mood after a software update. And it’s no secret that these rollercoaster markets have been shaking up mining stocks across the sector. Crypto market turmoil: Because why not? At the time of publication, CleanSpark shares were down 19.13%, hovering at $8.26. Investors are on edge as they wait for that earnings report, and with the volatility in the crypto sector, it’s anyone’s guess where the stock might land next. So far, analysts seem to be sticking with CleanSpark for the most part. The stock holds a Buy Rating with an average price target of $23.16. Recent analyst moves include: Keefe, Bruyette & Woods : Outperform (lowered target to $18.00) Maxim Group : Initiated with Buy (target $22.00) Chardan Capital : Buy (maintained target of $30.00) Technical talk: Don’t look. It’s ugly CleanSpark’s technicals are looking a bit grim, too. The stock is 25.9% below its 20-day simple moving average (SMA) and a whopping 34.9% below its 100-day SMA, indicating a serious short-term slump. Over the past year, shares have dropped 10.81%, and right now, they’re hanging out closer to their 52-week lows than their highs — not exactly where you’d want to be for a quick turnaround. With an RSI of 38.28 (aka neutral territory) and the MACD below its signal line, the stock seems to be caught in a bearish holding pattern. It’s not in full-on “panic sell” territory, but let’s just say the mood isn’t exactly “sunny and 75.”
